data.title: Christopher Eccleston: Straight male actors like me are pariahs
data.meta_description: Christopher Eccleston has said that white, middle-class, male, straight actors like him are “the new pariahs of the industry”.The former Doctor Who star — who despite his view that he belongs to an increasingly unwanted breed in acting appears in My Name Is Leon tonight on BBC2 — also said that he f
data.text:
Christopher Eccleston has said that white, middle-class, male, straight actors like him are “the new pariahs of the industry”.

The former Doctor Who star — who despite his view that he belongs to an increasingly unwanted breed in acting appears in My Name Is Leon tonight on BBC2 — also said that he felt a “failure”.

Eccleston, 58, told Times Radio: “Quite rightly I’m a dinosaur now. I’m white, I’m middle-aged, I’m male, and I’m straight. We are all seen through the lens of Harvey Weinstein et al. And I can feel that the opportunities are shrinking, as they should do.

“I’ve lived off the fat of the land for 30 years of my career, but I still have to pay my mortgage, I still
